results.name: Triangle of Euler-Bernoulli or Entringer numbers read by rows.
comment: Zig-Zag numbers (see the Conway and Guy reference p. 110 and the J.-P. Delahaye reference, p. 31).
Approximation to Pi: 2*n*a(n-1,n-1)/a(n,n), n >= 3. See A132049(n)/A132050(n). See the Delahaye reference, p. 31.

The sequence (a(n,n)) of the last element of each row is that of Euler up/down numbers A000111, the Boustrophedon transform of sequence A000007 = (0^n) = (1, 0, 0, 0, ...). - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 07 2017
reference: J. H. Conway and R. K. Guy, The Book of Numbers, New York: Springer-Verlag, p. 110.
J.-P. Delahaye, Pi - die Story (German translation), Birkhäuser, 1999 Basel, p. 31. French original: Le fascinant nombre Pi, Pour la Science, Paris, 1997.

formula: a(0,0)=1, a(n,m)=0 if n < m, a(n,m)=0 if m < 0, otherwise a(n,m) = Sum_{k=1..m} a(n-1,n-k).
